publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1871 Christine Grahame: Scottish Stamps—That the Parliament notes that while the new definitive Scottish stamps, launched in June 1999, should be available at Post Offices, they are not always available and are not available at other retail outlets and therefore calls upon the Royal Mail to ensure that these stamps are as widely accessible as possible, in particular that the 1st and 2nd class stamps are available at all times in Post Offices throughout Scotland and at the other usual retail outlets, including the Scottish Parliament’s shop, and to introduce books of the new definitive Scottish 1st and 2nd class stamps.

S1M-1871 Scottish Stamps (lodged on 25 April 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr George Reid*, Bruce Crawford*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Fiona McLeod*, Shona Robison*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1871 Christine Grahame: Scottish Stamps—That the Parliament notes that while the new definitive Scottish stamps, launched in June 1999, should be available at Post Offices, they are not always available and are not available at other retail outlets and therefore calls upon the Royal Mail to ensure that these stamps are as widely accessible as possible, in particular that the 1st and 2nd class stamps are available at all times in Post Offices throughout Scotland and at the other usual retail outlets, including the Scottish Parliament’s shop, and to introduce books of the new definitive Scottish 1st and 2nd class stamps. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr George Reid, Bruce Crawford, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fiona McLeod, Shona Robison, Tommy Sheridan, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1871 Scottish Stamps (lodged on 25 April 2001) Brian Adam*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1871 Scottish Stamps (lodged on 25 April 2001) Michael Russell*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Irene McGugan*
S1M-1871 Scottish Stamps (lodged on 25 April 2001) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Fiona Hyslop*, Dr Winnie Ewing*
S1M-1871 Scottish Stamps (lodged on 25 April 2001) Alasdair Morgan*

S1M-1871 Christine Grahame: Scottish Stamps—That the Parliament notes that while the new definitive Scottish stamps, launched in June 1999, should be available at Post Offices, they are not always available and are not available at other retail outlets and therefore calls upon the Royal Mail to ensure that these stamps are as widely accessible as possible, in particular that the 1st and 2nd class stamps are available at all times in Post Offices throughout Scotland and at the other usual retail outlets, including the Scottish Parliament’s shop, and to introduce books of the new definitive Scottish 1st and 2nd class stamps. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr George Reid, Bruce Crawford, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fiona McLeod, Shona Robison, Tommy Sheridan, Linda Fabiani, Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Michael Russell, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene McGugan, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Fiona Hyslop, Dr Winnie Ewing, Alasdair Morgan, Roseanna Cunningham*
S1M-1871 Scottish Stamps (lodged on 25 April 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Alex Neil*
S1M-1871 Scottish Stamps (lodged on 25 April 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1871 Christine Grahame: Scottish Stamps—That the Parliament notes that while the new definitive Scottish stamps, launched in June 1999, should be available at Post Offices, they are not always available and are not available at other retail outlets and therefore calls upon the Royal Mail to ensure that these stamps are as widely accessible as possible, in particular that the 1st and 2nd class stamps are available at all times in Post Offices throughout Scotland and at the other usual retail outlets, including the Scottish Parliament’s shop, and to introduce books of the new definitive Scottish 1st and 2nd class stamps. S1M-1871 Scottish Stamps (lodged on 25 April 2001) Ms Margo MacDonald*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
